alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Nicholas; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Nicholas, northeastern Kanawha, southeastern Roane and Clay Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pinch, or 11 miles east of Charleston, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clay, Clendenin, Pinch, Glen, Big Otter, Elkview, Amma, Wallback, Bickmore, Procious, Indore, Left Hand and Ivydale. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 7 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
